action.action-desc: Mr. Phillips introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Reform, and House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 to permit additional leave for bone marrow or blood stem cell donation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Life Saving Leave Act.

section.header: Entitlement to additional leave for bone marrow or blood stem cell donation

subsection.text: Section 102(a) of the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 (29 U.S.C. 2612(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following:

paragraph.header: Entitlement to additional leave for bone marrow or blood stem cell donation

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B) and section 103(g), an eligible employee shall be entitled to leave under this paragraph—

clause.text: for predonation activities relating to the making of a donation of bone marrow or blood stem cells for transplant;
for the making of such donation; and
for postdonation activities relating to the making of such donation.
An eligible employee shall be entitled to a total of 40 hours of leave under this paragraph during any 12-month period.
Leave under this paragraph shall be in addition to any leave provided under any other paragraph of this subsection.

subsection.text: Section 101(2) of the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 (29 U.S.C. 2611(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Employees requesting bone marrow or blood stem cell leave
subparagraph.text: The requirements of subparagraphs (A) and (B)(ii) shall not apply with respect to leave under section 102(a)(5).

subsection.text: Section 102(b)(1) of such Act (29 U.S.C. 2612(b)(1)) is amended by inserting after the third sentence the following: Subject to subsection (e)(4) and section 103(g), leave under subsection (a)(5) may be taken intermittently or on a reduced leave schedule..
Section 102(d)(2) of such Act (29 U.S.C. 2612(d)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Bone marrow or blood stem cell donation leave
subparagraph.text: An eligible employee may elect, but an employer may not require the employee, to substitute any of the accrued paid vacation leave, personal leave, or medical or sick leave of the employee for leave provided under subsection (a)(5) for any part of the 40 hours of such leave under such subsection, except that nothing in this title shall require an employer to provide paid sick leave or paid medical leave in any situation in which such employer would not normally provide any such paid leave.

subsection.text: Section 102(e) of such Act (29 U.S.C. 2612(e)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Notice relating to bone marrow or blood stem cell donation leave
paragraph.text: In any case in which the necessity for leave under subsection (a)(5) is foreseeable based on planned predonation, donation, or postdonation activities, the employee—

subparagraph.text: shall make a reasonable effort to schedule the treatment so as not to disrupt unduly the operations of the employer, subject to the approval of the relevant health care provider; and

shall provide the employer with not less than 30 days' notice, before the date the leave is to begin, of the employee's intention to take leave under such subparagraph, except that if the date of the treatment requires leave to begin in less than 30 days, the employee shall provide such notice as is practicable.

subsection.text: Section 103 of such Act (29 U.S.C. 2613) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Certification relating to bone marrow or blood stem cell donation leave
subsection.text: An employer may require that a request for leave under section 102(a)(5) be supported by a certification issued by a contractor of the registry functions of the C.W. Bill Young Cell Transplantation Program.
